title: Electronics & Communication Engineering (EC)
description: Comprehensive GATE Electronics & Communication Engineering assessment covering General Aptitude and Core EC subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core electronics & communication questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Electronics & Communication Engineering is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in electronics and communication engineering and related fields. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Electronics & Communication questions.

typicalCareers.title: Electronics Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Advanced electronics engineering positions in circuit design, communication systems, and signal processing

typicalCareers.title: PhD Candidate
typicalCareers.description: Pursue higher studies in electronics and communication engineering and related fields

typicalCareers.title: Communication Systems Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Senior technical roles in wireless communication, networking, and signal processing

whoShouldConsider: Electronics & Communication Engineering graduates preparing for GATE
Students seeking admission to M.Tech/M.E programs in electronics and communication
Professionals looking for PSU jobs in electronics sector
Researchers in electronics and communication engineering fields
idealTraits: Solid foundation in electronics and communication fundamentals
Good understanding of circuits, signals, and communication systems

modules: Core Electronics & Communication Assessment (55 questions, 85 marks)

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: If 'GATE' is coded as '9632', then 'EXAM' would be coded as:
questions.subject: Verbal Reasoning
questions.explanation: Each letter is assigned a unique number. G=9, A=6, T=3, E=2. Following the same pattern, E=2, X=8, A=6, M=5, giving us 5826.

questions.text: A train 120 meters long running at 60 km/hr crosses a platform in 30 seconds. What is the length of the platform?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: Speed = 60 km/hr = 60 × 5/18 = 50/3 m/s. Distance = Speed × Time = 50/3 × 30 = 500m. Platform length = 500 - 120 = 380 meters.

questions.text: Choose the word most similar in meaning to 'METICULOUS':
questions.subject: Verbal Ability
questions.explanation: Meticulous means showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.

questions.text: If the sum of three consecutive integers is 75, what is the middle integer?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: Let the integers be x, x+1, x+2. Then x + (x+1) + (x+2) = 75. Solving: 3x + 3 = 75, x = 24. Middle integer = 25.

questions.text: Complete the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
questions.subject: Analytical Reasoning

questions.text: In a class of 40 students, 28 students like cricket and 20 students like football. If each student likes at least one sport, how many students like both cricket and football?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: Using set theory: n(C ∪ F) = n(C) + n(F) - n(C ∩ F). So 40 = 28 + 20 - n(C ∩ F), giving n(C ∩ F) = 8.

questions.text: If A is taller than B, and B is taller than C, then:
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning
questions.explanation: This is a transitive relation. If A > B and B > C, then A > C.

questions.text: A shopkeeper marks his goods 40% above cost price and gives a discount of 20%. What is his profit percentage?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude

questions.text: Choose the correctly spelled word:
questions.subject: Verbal Ability
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is 'Accommodate' with double 'c' and double 'm'.

questions.text: A clock shows 3:00. What is the angle between hour and minute hands?
questions.subject: Quantitative Aptitude
questions.explanation: At 3:00, the minute hand points at 12 and hour hand points at 3. Angle = 3 × 30° = 90°.

core.title: Core Electronics & Communication Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment of core electronics and communication subjects including Electronic Devices, Analog Circuits, Digital Electronics, Signals and Systems, Control Systems, Communications, Electromagnetics, and Network Theory. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The mobility of electrons in a semiconductor is defined as:

options.text: Drift velocity per unit electric field
Current density per unit electric field

questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: Mobility (μ) is defined as the drift velocity (vd) acquired by a charge carrier per unit electric field (E). μ = vd/E.

questions.text: For a common emitter amplifier with voltage gain -100, if the input resistance is 1kΩ and load resistance is 10kΩ, what is the current gain?
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Voltage gain Av = -β × RL/Rin. Given Av = -100, RL = 10kΩ, Rin = 1kΩ. So -100 = -β × 10/1, giving β = 1000.

questions.text: In a BJT, the base width in the active region is:

options.text: Much smaller than the collector width
Much larger than both emitter and collector

questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: In a BJT, the base region is made very thin (much smaller than collector) to ensure most injected carriers reach the collector.

questions.text: The Nyquist sampling theorem states that the sampling frequency should be:

options.text: Equal to the maximum signal frequency
At least twice the maximum signal frequency
At least half the maximum signal frequency
Equal to the minimum signal frequency

questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Nyquist theorem: To avoid aliasing, the sampling frequency fs must be at least 2fm, where fm is the maximum frequency component in the signal.

questions.text: A system with transfer function H(s) = 1/(s+1) is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: H(s) = 1/(s+1) has a pole at s = -1. At DC (s=0), H(0)=1. As frequency increases, |H(jω)| decreases. This is a low-pass filter.

questions.text: The bandwidth of an FM signal depends on:

options.text: Both modulation index and message frequency

questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: FM bandwidth is given by Carson's rule: BW ≈ 2(Δf + fm), where Δf is frequency deviation (related to modulation index) and fm is message frequency.

questions.text: The intrinsic impedance of free space is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: The intrinsic impedance of free space η₀ = √(μ₀/ε₀) ≈ 377 Ω or 120π Ω. Option B is more precise.

questions.text: For a MOSFET operating in saturation region, the drain current is proportional to:
questions.subject: Electronic Devices
questions.explanation: In saturation region, ID = (μnCox W/2L)(VGS - VT)², showing quadratic dependence on (VGS - VT).

questions.text: The maximum power transfer theorem states that maximum power is delivered when:

options.text: Load impedance is twice the source impedance

questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: Maximum power transfer occurs when the load impedance ZL equals the complex conjugate of source impedance ZS*.

questions.text: The time complexity of Quick Sort algorithm in the average case is:
questions.subject: Digital Logic
questions.explanation: Quick Sort has an average time complexity of O(n log n), though worst case is O(n²).

questions.text: In a common emitter amplifier, the phase relationship between input and output is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Common emitter amplifier provides 180° phase shift between input and output due to the transistor's inverting nature.

questions.text: The cut-off frequency of a first-order RC low-pass filter is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Cut-off frequency fc = 1/(2πRC) for a first-order RC low-pass filter.

questions.text: The number of flip-flops required for a MOD-16 counter is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: For MOD-N counter, n flip-flops are needed where 2^n ≥ N. For MOD-16: 2^4 = 16, so 4 flip-flops required.

questions.text: The Laplace transform of unit step function u(t) is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: L{u(t)} = 1/s for s > 0, where u(t) is the unit step function.

questions.text: In a feedback control system, the steady-state error for a unit step input to a Type-1 system is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Type-1 system has one integrator. For step input, steady-state error ess = 1/(1+Kp) = 0 since Kp = ∞.

questions.text: The bandwidth of an AM signal is:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: AM signal bandwidth = 2fm, where fm is the maximum frequency of the modulating signal.

questions.text: The electric field intensity E and magnetic field intensity H are related by:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: In electromagnetic waves, E = ηH, where η is the intrinsic impedance of the medium.

questions.text: The voltage gain of an op-amp inverting amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: For inverting amplifier: Av = -Rf/Ri, where Rf is feedback resistance and Ri is input resistance.

questions.text: The Z-transform of x[n] = aⁿu[n] is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Z-transform of aⁿu[n] = Σ(aⁿz⁻ⁿ) = z/(z-a) for |z| > |a|.

questions.text: The characteristic impedance of a transmission line depends on:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Characteristic impedance Z₀ = √[(R + jωL)/(G + jωC)] depends on per-unit-length parameters L, C, R, G.

questions.text: The efficiency of a class A amplifier is maximum when:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Class A amplifier has maximum theoretical efficiency of 50% under ideal conditions.

questions.text: The frequency response of a system is plotted in:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Frequency response can be represented using Bode plots, Nyquist plots, or root locus diagrams.

questions.text: The number of address lines required for a 1K × 8 memory is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: 1K = 1024 = 2^10, so 10 address lines are needed to address 1024 locations.

questions.text: The Fourier transform of a rectangular pulse is:
questions.subject: Signals and Systems
questions.explanation: Fourier transform of rectangular pulse is sinc function: F{rect(t)} = sinc(ω/2).

questions.text: The power factor of a purely resistive circuit is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: Power factor = cos(φ) where φ is phase angle. For purely resistive circuit, φ = 0°, so PF = cos(0°) = 1.

questions.text: The modulation index of an AM signal is 0.5. The power efficiency is:
questions.subject: Communications

questions.text: The input impedance of a common base amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Common base amplifier has very low input impedance (approximately re = 26mV/IE).

questions.text: The phase velocity of an electromagnetic wave in free space is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Phase velocity in free space = c = 3 × 10⁸ m/s (speed of light).

questions.text: The resolution of an 8-bit ADC with full-scale voltage 5V is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics

questions.text: The stability of a system is determined by:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: System stability is determined by the location of closed-loop poles. All poles must be in left half of s-plane for stability.

questions.text: The bandwidth of a series RLC circuit at resonance is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: Bandwidth BW = R/L for series RLC circuit, where R is resistance, L is inductance.

questions.text: The number of comparators required for a 3-bit flash ADC is:
questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: For n-bit flash ADC, number of comparators = 2^n - 1. For 3-bit: 2^3 - 1 = 7 comparators.

questions.text: The group velocity of a wave packet is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Group velocity vg = dω/dk, where ω is angular frequency and k is wave number.

questions.text: The output of a differentiator circuit for a sine wave input is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Differentiator output = d/dt(sin(ωt)) = ωcos(ωt), which is a cosine wave.

questions.text: The noise figure of a noiseless amplifier is:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: Noise figure F = 1 for noiseless amplifier. In dB: NF = 10 log(F) = 10 log(1) = 0 dB.

questions.text: The Q-factor of a parallel RLC circuit is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: Q-factor for parallel RLC circuit = R√(C/L).

questions.text: The propagation constant of a transmission line is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Propagation constant γ = α + jβ, where α is attenuation constant and β is phase constant.

questions.text: The slew rate of an op-amp is measured in:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Slew rate is the maximum rate of change of output voltage, typically measured in V/μs.

questions.text: The frequency deviation in FM is proportional to:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: Frequency deviation Δf = kf × Am, where kf is frequency sensitivity and Am is amplitude of modulating signal.

questions.text: The input bias current of an op-amp is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Input bias current IB = (IB+ + IB-)/2, which is the average of the two input bias currents.

questions.text: The skin depth in a conductor is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Skin depth δ = 1/√(πfμσ), where f is frequency, μ is permeability, σ is conductivity.

questions.text: The resolution of a DAC is determined by:

options.text: Both number of bits and reference voltage

questions.subject: Digital Electronics
questions.explanation: DAC resolution = Vref/(2^n - 1), where n is number of bits and Vref is reference voltage.

questions.text: The phase margin of a system is:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Phase margin = 180° - |phase at gain crossover frequency|.

questions.text: The power spectral density of white noise is:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: White noise has constant power spectral density across all frequencies.

questions.text: The voltage gain of a common collector amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Common collector (emitter follower) has voltage gain slightly less than 1, typically 0.95-0.99.

questions.text: The impedance of a quarter-wave transformer is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Quarter-wave transformer impedance ZT = √(Z1Z2), where Z1 and Z2 are the impedances to be matched.

questions.text: The settling time of a system is the time required for the response to:
questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Settling time is the time required for the response to reach and stay within 2% of the final value.

questions.text: The dynamic range of a system is:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: Dynamic range is the ratio of the largest to smallest signal that can be processed by the system.

questions.text: The current gain of a common emitter amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Common emitter current gain is β (hfe), which is the ratio of collector current to base current.

questions.text: The radiation resistance of a half-wave dipole is:
questions.subject: Electromagnetics
questions.explanation: Half-wave dipole has radiation resistance of approximately 73 Ω.

questions.text: The overshoot in a second-order system depends on:

options.text: Both natural frequency and damping ratio

questions.subject: Control Systems
questions.explanation: Overshoot depends only on damping ratio ζ. For underdamped systems: %OS = 100 × e^(-ζπ/√(1-ζ²)).

questions.text: The efficiency of a class B push-pull amplifier is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Class B push-pull amplifier has maximum theoretical efficiency of 78.5% (π/4).

questions.text: The bandwidth of a series RLC circuit is:
questions.subject: Network Theory
questions.explanation: Bandwidth BW = R/L for series RLC circuit, where R is resistance and L is inductance.

questions.text: The noise temperature of a noiseless amplifier is:
questions.subject: Communications
questions.explanation: Noiseless amplifier has noise temperature of 0 K, meaning it adds no noise to the signal.

questions.text: The input offset voltage of an ideal op-amp is:
questions.subject: Analog Circuits
questions.explanation: Ideal op-amp has zero input offset voltage, meaning no voltage difference between inputs when output is zero.

results.title: GATE Electronics & Communication Engineering Assessment Results
results.description: Your comprehensive GATE Electronics & Communication Engineering assessment results with detailed analysis and recommendations for improvement.
